string-array.name: electronic_defs_name
string-array.item: An ideal and real power source

string-array.name: electronic_defs
string-array.item:
This law associates current and voltage with a resistor resistance.
 I=U/R I[A]=U[V]/R[Ω] R[Ω]=U[V]/I[A]
 I - current flowing through the resistor expressed in Amps A
 U - voltage applied to the resistor expressed in volts V
 R - resistor resistance expressed in Ohms Ω
The sum of the currents flowing into the network node equals the sum of the currents flowing from the network node.
The sum of the source voltages in the grid mesh equals the sum of the decreases in the receiver voltages in the grid mesh.

Any system can be replaced from the side of the AB terminals with a system composed of an ideal source voltage, with the voltage prevailing on the AB terminals in idle state (without load) and from the equivalent resistance seen from the AB terminals (in idle state) after a short circuit all voltage sources and all current sources open.

string-array.name: physics_defs_name
string-array.item: Analytical and graphic presentation of the equation of motion as well as the time dependence of velocity and acceleration in uniformly accelerated one-dimensional motion
Analytical and graphical presentation of the equation of motion and time dependence of velocity and acceleration in uniform one-dimensional motion
Movement of the body projected at an angle to the horizon: analytical and graphic description

string-array.name: physics_defs
string-array.item:
If the body is not affected by external forces, or acting forces balance, this body remains at rest or moves in a uniform, straight motion. F=m*g, where
 F- force [N]
 m- body weight [kg]
 g- gravitational acceleration [N/kg]
 Application e.g. ball lying on the table

The acceleration of the body is directly proportional to the force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.\n This law can be expressed by the equation: force is equal to mass multiplied by acceleration (F = ma).

Each action evokes an equal and opposite reaction.\ Newton law of universal gravitation states that there is an attractive, proportional force between the two bodies\ to their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

Motion - changing the position of one body relative to another, which we call the reference system.\n Speed ​​- change of distance in a unit of time.\n Acceleration - is the rate of change of speed uniform acceleration a = v-v0/t

Motion - changing the position of one body relative to another, which we call the reference system. \n Speed ​​- change of distance in a unit of time. \ n Acceleration - is the rate of speed change \ n Speed ​​in steady motion - v = x-x0/t-t0
